metadata.titel_preek: God’s Alien Work in the World

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Stranger (God) reveals Himself to the Partisan (Believer) in a moment of intimacy, establishing a bond of trust that must withstand the subsequent 'alien work' of silence, pain, and apparent betrayal.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ... came down into our perilous, death-dealing world

object.identificatie: The preservation of trust/faith in the midst of suffering

zender.identificatie: The Word of God / The Scriptures
tekstueel_bewijs: The Bible simply declares him to us
We have met him in the Word

ontvanger.identificatie: The Partisan / The Hearer (those in 'deathly conflict')
tekstueel_bewijs: addresses itself to those who know the dread

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Holy Spirit (implied through Word and Sacrament)
tekstueel_bewijs: the only Son... he has made him known
met him in the Word, in the Lord’s Supper

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Alien Work' (Pain, Death, Silence, The Skeptic)
tekstueel_bewijs: the Skeptic continues to rear his head
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a moral failing but the ontological weight of death and the 'deus absconditus' (hidden God).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's 'stubborn' persistence in faith as a response to the primary revelation.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (e.g., George Britt, The Partisan)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Refusal to allow pain to count decisively against God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human 'stubbornness' is a secondary reaction to the primary 'impression created by the Stranger'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Scripture → God's Goodness → The Suffering Believer

voorbeelden_god_subject: the only Son... has made him known
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We are not asked to gloss over

voorbeelden: the theologian is bound in certain ways
He knew something in his own person
from his fullness have we all received

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power/Grace) given by God to endure the 'Devoir' of faith when human 'Savoir' (understanding) fails.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S1 to S2, rejects ~S2 (moralistic glossing), and finds resolution in Christ who occupies S2 to restore S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ experiences the 'full force of the conflict,' bridging the gap between the Alien and Proper work.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon refuses to 'soften' Psalm 88.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies God as the primary actor even in His absence and places the burden of revelation entirely on Christ.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Active Subject of Salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: In Jesus Christ, God has shown us himself
the dread of a deathly conflict

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Isaiah, Job, Paul) are used as co-sufferers and witnesses to God's action, not as moral templates for the hearer to copy.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of 'proving' God; permission to lament.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Faith is a gift/bond established by the 'Stranger', not a logical conclusion.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative of the 'Stranger' perfectly integrates the problem of evil with the theology of the Cross.
spanning_punten: The tension between God's 'left hand' and 'right hand'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ... experienced in himself the full force of the conflict.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the 'strengthening' to the 'Lord of life', functioning as an endowment of power.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin/death is an 'alien work' that only God can navigate.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. The 'Stranger' parable acts as the actantial engine, moving the hearer from a Subject (trying to defend God) to a Receiver (trusting the Stranger).

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on 'Savoir' (philosophical debate) in the introduction.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: The transition to 'Pouvoir' in the Christological section is excellent.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'Lord's Supper' mention is expanded to emphasize the physical 'Pouvoir' of the sacrament.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (death/silence) is already at maximum intensity.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's work) remains primary; ethics (stubborn belief) is the response.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in avoiding moralistic apologetics by centering the narrative on the character of the 'Stranger' revealed in Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the parables' persuasiveness; Greimas reveals that the parables function to switch the Subject from the 'Defending Human' to the 'Acting God'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would explain Isaiah 28; semiotics shows how the 'Alien Work' functions as a narrative 'Opponent' that necessitates a 'Subject-switch' to Christ.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'Skeptic' is not just a person but a functional 'Opponent' actant that tests the 'Transmission Axis' (Sender-Receiver relationship).

volledige_object_lijst: the full force of the conflict
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Stranger' parable to redefine the 'Axis of Desire' from 'Understanding why' to 'Trusting Who'.
